page.title: 01Rigmore & Bigbury Parishes
page.content: A highly cultivated section of South Hams mechanised farm land intersected by narrow lanes and valleys with two small villages with churches, three ancient Inns and odd hamlets. There are thirteen farms comprising mainly large areas of arable sown with corn and rotated with roots, vegetables and grass land. Grazing is mainly for sheep. There are four dairy herds principally Friesians. cows and sheep are frequently herded from Land Rovers. Poultry production is also in evience and Pigs are few. Horses are for sport. Narrow lanes of great antiquity running between neat banked hedges cut by mechanical slashers are a feature. Deep valleys have perrenial streams. The area is peopled by farmers, professional families, retired couples single people and seasonal holiday makers.
